arguments.name: Dark Mode Feature Implementation
arguments.description: Project to implement dark mode feature for the app, improving user experience in low-light environments.

arguments.name: Dark Mode Implementation
arguments.problem_statement: Users experience eye strain in low-light environments, leading to reduced app engagement and satisfaction. Implementing a dark mode feature will improve readability and reduce visual fatigue during nighttime usage.
arguments.success_criteria: App switches to a dark theme with customizable color schemes, reducing eye strain by 20% and increasing user retention in low-light conditions by 30% within 3 months.

results.task_name: Break down a feature into tasks

arguments.name: Implement User Notifications
arguments.problem_statement: Users need to be notified in real-time when workunits are updated to stay informed about progress, changes, and completion status.
arguments.success_criteria: The notification system successfully sends email and in-app alerts to all relevant users upon workunit status changes (e.g., active → completed, paused → active), with 100% test coverage for all user roles and environments.

arguments.name: User Notifications Implementation
arguments.description: Project for implementing real-time user notifications for workunit updates

arguments.name: Implement User Notifications
arguments.problem_statement: Users need to be notified in real-time when workunits are updated to stay informed about progress, changes, and completion status.
arguments.success_criteria: The notification system successfully sends email and in-app alerts to all relevant users upon workunit status changes (e.g., active → completed, paused → active), with 100% test coverage for all user roles and environments.

arguments.title: Design notification schema and database structure
arguments.description: Define tables for user notification preferences, notification types, and status change events to store user-specific notification settings and track triggered notifications.

arguments.title: Quarterly Audit Review
arguments.content: This workunit was reviewed during the quarterly audit and its current status (active) was confirmed.

arguments.title: Switched from polling to WebSockets for real-time notifications
arguments.content: We decided to use WebSockets instead of polling for real-time notifications. This provides lower latency and more efficient communication compared to polling, which can be resource-intensive and leads to unnecessary server load. Tradeoffs considered: WebSockets require maintaining a persistent connection, which may increase initial server overhead, but the benefits in real-time updates outweigh this for our use case.
